Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: This course helped me develop skills that pertain to multiple modes of writing. I also learned how to form an argument, conduct research, and use evidence to express a viewpoint.

I learned how to write effective research papers and synthesize multiple professional sources and communicate effectively across multiple mediums. I also gained a new perspective on how to approach questions surrounding technology.

I gained very concrete skills in analyzing literary sources and writing papers. The practice I received from four different writing assignments was invaluable and extremely helpful. I also learned a lot about the history of technology, as well as the philosophical basis for understanding technology. More importantly, I learned that technology is mostly whatever we define it to be, and that we should think carefully as a society about what direction we're heading in.
I learned about the effects of technology on society and how to read and write more analytically.

As a student with limited prior skills in writing, I took this course to improve my writing skills and learn from other students. I can say that this course has helped me improve my writing, and the readings also exposed me to various aspects of technology I had not previously thought about. This is definitely a course I would recommend. Also, my instructor was amazing!

I learned how to hold a high-level academic conversation in an open environment. This course improved my writing skills and helped me think critically about various situations concerning the ethics and consequences of technological development.
I learned a lot about the different views on various different technologies through the ages, especially regarding nuclear technology.

Much better argumentative skills when writing papers, and better peer-editing skills. The course topic (discussing various technologies and their impact on society) proved to be much more interesting than I anticipated, and I feel that my outlook on technology as a whole is much more defined.
Greatly improved ability to plan out arguments and essays. learned techniques to create complex arguments. Very metacognitive.

Through this course, I was able to develop my skills as a writer, transitioning to a college mindset in my papers. I have also been able to learn all of the ways I can reach out to obtain help and resources, with the writing tutors being a prime example.
One strength of this course was allowing the students to edit each other's papers. This occurrence greatly helped develop ideas before the final draft was due.
The course deals with interesting material across multiple mediums and is engaging as a result. There arent many apparent weaknesses in the course.

One of the strengths of this course was absolutely the material we read and the discussions we generated. The range of readings was good, with both philosophical essays and more contemporary opinion writing, as well as video and audio pieces. Another strength was the spacing of the writing assignments, with each being apropos of a certain thematic grouping in the course. There were a few weaknesses, such as a few readings that seemed a little out of place - particularly the visit to the Eli Whitney Museum and an inscrutable essay by Heidegger. These could be fixed very easily, however, simply by substituting other readings or activities. There were no structural problems with the course and overall it was very good.

Strengths: Manageable readings; Occasional movies and TV episodes; Submission of drafts for feedback; Small seminar; Flexible deadlines; My class was interesting and taught well.
Weaknesses: Length requirements for papers; Some readings were dense; There could have been more debate amongst students.
The feedback received on various essay drafts were very helpful. However, he emphasis was more on writing drafts than it was on pointing out what actually makes a good essay.

This course was strong in its seminar conversations and having relatively light homework. The course could be improved by implementing more out-of-classroom collaboration rather than leaving individuals to do work.

Strengths: very helpful in-class workshops to improve papers, and very thought-provoking discussions that were easy to contribute to due to the small class size. Weaknesses: one or two people mainly took over discussions every time, but that is not necessarily a weakness.
The deadlines were a bit ambitious at first, but revisions of the deadlines solved the issue.
Personally, the flexible assignment schedule was something I greatly benefited from. Although it was sometimes confusing not having set due dates, overall it made my semester much more manageable.
Yes, especially to first year students. The skills that taking this course develops can be implemented in any discipline.
Yes, but since the material is organized towards technology and philosophies surrounding it, it may not be engaging for everyone.

I would definitely recommend this course, without reservations. It was both interesting and enjoyable. The readings were generally well-selected, in a variety of different fields but still grouped by major themes. The writing assignments were well-planned and I received good feedback. Professor Lane was really excellent and a great teacher.

I would recommend this course to students looking for a WR credit. The ability to submit drafts was especially great, since it spread out the work and let students receive feedback before submitting final versions.
Yes. I learnt a lot from it
Yes. While rigorous, ENGL 114 was well worth taking. The effort I put into the course made me significantly better at writing and developing a logical argument. I am happy to have
Yes! I loved this course with Isabel Lane. She is such a wonderful and kind teacher, and I feel like my writing has improved a lot with her.
Yes - this course greatly improved my writing skills.
If you want to level up on writing, this is the way to go.
I would recommend this course to another student, as the topics covered are very interesting.
